## ConnectionChecker class

Class for connection type checking logic.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class ConnectionChecker implements IConnectionChecker 
```
<b>Implements:</b> [IConnectionChecker](./blockly.iconnectionchecker_interface.md)

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [canConnect(a, b, isDragging, opt\_distance)](./blockly.connectionchecker_class.canconnect_1_method.md) |  | Check whether the current connection can connect with the target connection. |
|  [canConnectToPrevious\_(a, b)](./blockly.connectionchecker_class.canconnecttoprevious__1_method.md) | <code>protected</code> | Helper function for drag checking. |
|  [canConnectWithReason(a, b, isDragging, opt\_distance)](./blockly.connectionchecker_class.canconnectwithreason_1_method.md) |  | Checks whether the current connection can connect with the target connection, and return an error code if there are problems. |
|  [doDragChecks(a, b, distance)](./blockly.connectionchecker_class.dodragchecks_1_method.md) |  | Check whether this connection can be made by dragging. |
|  [doSafetyChecks(a, b)](./blockly.connectionchecker_class.dosafetychecks_1_method.md) |  | Check that connecting the given connections is safe, meaning that it would not break any of Blockly's basic assumptions (e.g. no self connections). |
|  [doTypeChecks(a, b)](./blockly.connectionchecker_class.dotypechecks_1_method.md) |  | Check whether this connection is compatible with another connection with respect to the value type system. E.g. square\_root("Hello") is not compatible. |
|  [getErrorMessage(errorCode, a, b)](./blockly.connectionchecker_class.geterrormessage_1_method.md) |  | Helper method that translates a connection error code into a string. |
